pages.text: O-Horses (and other equines) can wear a variety of colorful blankets. You can choose from Carpet, Medieval, Modern, Racer or Western, in a variety of different dye colors. Similarly, if Medieval Embroidery is installed, you can use Caparisons and Rump Straps in the same way.

Blankets can be placed in the decor slot of an O-Equine. They are simply cosmetic and offer no protection. Medieval, Modern, Racer and Western blankets are their own items, but normal vanilla carpets can be used too.
Caparisons come with Medieval Embroidery compatibility. They can be placed in the decor slot of an O-Horse and can be worn alongside armor. They are simply cosmetic and offer no protection.

Rump Straps come with Medieval Embroidery compatibility. They can be placed in the decor OR armor slot of an O-Horse, so they can be worn alongside armor or blankets. They are simply cosmetic and offer no protection.

O-Horses' manes and tails grow over time. Wild horses may come in all sorts of mane and tail combinations. You can set the mane or tail to Button Braids or Tied by shift-clicking an O-Horse, as long as it's tail and/ or mane aren't too long or too short, or vice-versa.
Mane Types: $(br)Short, Roached, Long, None, Button Braids. $(br2)Tail Types: $(br)Very Short, Short, Natural, Long, Tied.
The $(l)Mane Scissors$() are used to cut the manes of O-Horses. Cutting your horse's mane offers no extra advantage other than looking pretty.
The $(l)Tail Scissors$() are used to cut the tails of O-Horses. Cutting your horse's tail offers no extra advantage other than looking pretty.
